image.altText: A person is silhouetted against a large illuminated red channel 7 logo.

props.synopsis: Four Corners has spoken to more than 200 people to investigate allegations of Channel Seven's toxic culture, uncovering allegations of bullying, sexism, and exploitation.

title.children: Channel 7 sells itself as a family network. Staff say behind the scenes its culture is 'brutal'

image.altText: Marles US UK signing AUKUS document

props.synopsis: A revamped version of the AUKUS agreement includes indemnity for the US and UK against any radioactive waste accidents and lets them walk away with one year's notice.

title.children: AUKUS deal would allow US and UK to walk away, with Australia to cover risk of loss or injury

image.altText: A hotel roof on fire.

props.synopsis: Up to 400 people were evacuated from the DoubleTree by Hilton on Cairns Esplanade after the crash, which set the top of the building alight.

title.children: Pilot flying stolen helicopter killed after crashing into Cairns hotel

image.altText: A mid-shot of Linda Reynolds with her husband Robert Reid, arriving at court in Perth.

props.synopsis: Linda Reynolds's partner tells a defamation trial of the significant deterioration in her health after Brittany Higgins's rape allegation was made public, after an interview on Channel 10's The Project.

title.children: 'We might lose her': Linda Reynolds's partner says senator's health was dire after The Project interview

props.synopsis: The government is still yet to respond to its parliamentary inquiry into the harm caused by online gambling, which the late Labor MP Peta Murphy chaired.

title.children: Gambling reform advocate says Labor MPs will speak out if PM doesn't deliver Peta Murphy ad ban

image.altText: Jess Fox smiles as an Australian fan takes a selfie, in front of a bunch of other fans

props.synopsis: The Paris Olympics can officially be marked down as a complete success, but it was away from the athletic feats on fields and in pools that real value of the Games could be found.

title.children: What the Paris Olympics taught us about joy, hope and each other

image.altText: Joe biden seen against a black background looking serious

props.synopsis: The 81-year-old gives his first interview since quitting the race, discussing Donald Trump, the Harris-Walz ticket, and what will be at stake in November.

title.children: Donald Trump 'a genuine danger', says outgoing president Joe Biden in first interview after quitting re-election bid

image.altText: nsw police officers in the courtyard of a unit complex in burwood stand outside a covered structure after body of man found

props.synopsis: NSW Police has located two bodies after responding to reports of a concern for welfare at a Burwood building complex.

title.children: Police pore over CCTV footage after bodies of man and woman found at Sydney complex

image.altText: USMC MV-22 Osprey

props.synopsis: Almost a year since the tragedy, the US Marine Corp has released the findings from an investigation into an Osprey crash in northern Australia that killed three people and injured 20 others.

title.children: US Marines blame 'poor decisions' for Osprey crash that killed three marines in remote NT

image.altText: NSW Premier Chris Minns speaks to the media outdoors on April 24, 2024

props.synopsis: NSW Premier Chris Minns said the night-time economy would benefit from alcohol restrictions being eased, however, the substance should stay out of parliament.

title.children: NSW premier says it should be easier to get a drink in Sydney, with one exception

image.altText: Jessica Fox cries tears of joy and holds her sister Noemie's face after Noemie wins the women's kayak cross

props.synopsis: Countless moments have been created over the last fortnight. We thought we'd pass the baton over to our readers to hear their favourite moments from the Paris Olympics.

title.children: 'Absolutely magical': Readers share their favourite moments from the Paris Olympics

image.altText: Albanese gestures with a hand on the lower house floor.

props.synopsis: The Greens will put more pressure on the government to fully ban gambling advertising, and the prime minister says criticism of breakdancer Rachael Gunn is "a bit unfair".

title.children: Greens to force vote on gambling advertising ban, PM says lay off of Raygun — as it happened

image.altText: Relay team

props.synopsis: Australia is always one of the most well-represented countries at the Olympics, boasting a team of 460 athletes this year in Paris. Here is a state-by-state breakdown of the record-breaking team that has taken the Games by storm.

title.children: Australia's team has broken records in Paris — but which states are responsible for the most Olympic gold medals?

image.altText: A woman with short hair in an apartment holding a portrait photo of a man in a suit.

props.synopsis: Over the 21st century, fatal overdoses have begun to grow in Australia's suburban and regional areas. Some say the answer is safe injecting facilities. But would it help?

title.children: As overdoses surge ahead in Australia's suburbs, is the solution a safe space to use drugs?

image.altText: Raygun performs at the Paris Olympics

props.synopsis: Australia's Raygun may have scored zero points in the breakdancing event, but the lead judge says her performance is exactly what the competition at the Olympics was all about.

title.children: 'All about originality': Olympics breakdancing judge joins community backing Raygun amid online criticism

image.altText: The side of a building with a wall collapsed and trees desrtoyed with rubble around

props.synopsis: Gazan officials say at least 90 people were killed in an air strike on a school, but Israel is refuting the severity, claiming it was targeting Hamas militants.

title.children: Israel struck a Gaza school on the weekend. Here's what we know

image.altText: A close up of a McDonalds sign above a restraunt on a street.

props.synopsis: Concerned shareholders are using their small financial stakes to push companies like McDonald's to confront the issue. Here's what happened when a group of Texan nuns and an Australian super fund did just that.

title.children: Why the rise of 'superbugs' could have the same impact as the next global financial crisis

image.altText: Snoop Dogg, the Golden Voyager, and Leon marchand composite image at the paris olympics closing ceremony

props.synopsis: From a sci-fi adventure to an athlete rebellion, movie icons and a banging soundtrack linking the Stade de France to Venice Beach, here's all the best bits from the Paris Olympics' Closing Ceremony.

title.children: Closing Ceremony quick hits: Snoop Dogg raps, Tom Cruise rides, and Raygun gets the Aussies pumped up in Paris spectacle

image.altText: A man wearing a black suit and red tie speaking at a desk

props.synopsis: Fiji's prime minister, Sitiveni Rabuka, says he will "apologise" to fellow Melanesian leaders later this month after failing to secure agreement from Indonesia to visit its restive West Papua province.

title.children: Fiji's PM 'will apologise' to Pacific leaders as he awaits agreement to visit West Papua

image.altText: Sydney Swans coach John Longmire walking inside Docklands Stadium before an AFL match

props.synopsis: Sydney coach John Longmire has fired back at Collingwood counterpart Craig McRae over the "extraordinary admission" in his comments about a contentious umpiring decision.

title.children: Swans coach fires back after MCG swipe against officials made by Collingwood's McRae after loss

image.altText: A group of actors dressed as the Borderland characters stare into the camera

props.synopsis: The adaptation of beloved video game Borderlands has been mired in controversy from the start. Now it's here, can the star-studded cast breathe life into this film?

title.children: Video game adaptations have gotten a lot better, but new film Borderlands sets us back a decade

image.altText: A man winces looking at the camera as he wrings liquid from some black material.

props.synopsis: In the deeply disparaging texts, the former Spotlight executive producer repeatedly refers to a fictitious character wanting to cave someone's head in.

title.children: Former Seven Spotlight boss's 'anti-Semitic' text messages revealed

image.altText: A man celebrates scoring a try in a rugby league match

props.synopsis: The South Sydney Rabbitohs and NRL integrity unit are aware of a photograph of Latrell Mitchell circulating on social media.

title.children: NRL integrity unit made aware of Latrell Mitchell photo circulating on social media

image.altText: A composite image of a woman wearing a mustard yellow jumper

props.synopsis: A teenager who killed a woman by driving over her and dragging her more than 100 metres in Perth's northern suburbs pleads guilty to manslaughter.

title.children: Teenager pleads guilty to manslaughter of woman who was dragged along road in Perth hit-and-run

props.synopsis: Police say there were people in a 24-hour gym upstairs from the barber shop when it was set alight and it was lucky nobody was injured or killed.

title.children: Alleged arsonist accidentally sets himself alight during barber shop break-in

image.altText: Jess and Noemie Fox next to the Eiffel Tower

props.synopsis: As Paris signs off on a Games that featured the very best of what the sporting world can do, Australia can bask in the glory of staggering achievement.

title.children: The golden glow around Paris 2024 was lit by the athletes that competed — and Australia was at the centre of it all

image.altText: A man walks on the street in a suit

props.synopsis: Adrian Adams treated 60 patients — including a five-month-old infant — after being suspended by the health practitioner watchdog following complaints by patients and staff at his Gold Coast clinics.

title.children: Chiropractor fined for treating patients, including baby, while suspended over alcohol use

image.altText: beachside mansions at noosa heads

props.synopsis: Across Australia renters are facing record-high rents and low vacancy rates. But how much platforms like Stayz and Airbnb are to blame depends on who you ask.

title.children: Renters fear being pushed out of coastal market where short-term stays outnumber rentals 17 to 1

image.altText: Eagles young female fan with facepaint

props.synopsis: The Tiwi Islands are celebrating their newest football heroes, with the Ranku Eagles men's team seizing victory and the Tapalinga Superstars shooting to the top of the newly-established women's league.

title.children: Thousands turn out to witness new reigning premiers on the football-mad Tiwi Islands

image.altText: Two AFP cars and an officer outside Parliament House.

props.synopsis: The union representing Australian Federal Police officers warns that officers will abandon their posts at Parliament House later this week if their pay demands are not met.

title.children: 'We stop terrorists': AFP officers threaten to walk off the job at Parliament House amid pay dispute

image.altText: Two huge towers are seen from far away with black smoke billowing from the right one, with a river in front of them

props.synopsis: A cooling tower away from the main nuclear reactors was on fire as Ukraine's president accused Russia of destabilising the safety of the plant.

title.children: Fire extinguished at Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant

image.altText: A young man in family photos after his death in a workplace accident.

props.synopsis: After lengthy negotiations, lawyers for the company have indicated it will admit responsibility for the death of 26-year-old Haydyn Grubb, who was crushed and killed at its Kalgoorlie workshop in 2020.

title.children: Engineering firm Monadelphous to plead guilty over worker's death

image.altText: An older man walks outside court with media microphones held up towards him.

props.synopsis: It's alleged the now 68-year-old man committed 49 offences against 19 young people during his time as a teacher between 1988 and 1990.

title.children: Former teacher accused of 49 child sex offences of boys and girls says he was 'shocked' by charges

image.altText: A medium sized dog with white fluffy hair sits, with a woman behind her.

props.synopsis: Animal rescue organisations say they are struggling to cope amid a surge in pet surrenders, with RSPCA ACT saying they are seeing a 30 to 40 per cent increase from last year.

title.children: Designer dogs among pets being abandoned as rescue organisations swamped by unwanted animals
